body: I have the same issue, through docker it's not working, however use pip package and everything should be fine

@EnzoNclt I got it working via pip. However I am not able to go very far. Right now atleast it communicates.
With the following code for annotation -
```py
from fastapi import FastAPI
import uvicorn
from pydantic import BaseModel
import spacy

nlp = spacy.load("en_core_web_trf")

class TextToAnnotate(BaseModel):
    text: str

app = FastAPI()

@app.post("/auto_annotate")
async def auto_annotate(document: TextToAnnotate):
    doc = nlp(document.text)
    ent_label_list = []
    for ent in doc.ents:
        ent_label_list.append({ "label": ent.label_, "start_offset": ent.start_char, "end_offset": ent.end_char })
    print(ent_label_list)
    return ent_label_list

if __name__=="__main__":
    uvicorn.run("auto_annotate:app", host='0.0.0.0', port=7000)
```
What I am having a hard time understanding is this, in postman I send the sentence to be annotated as json in "body". Here, I have added the "text" key to the Body but not provided any value because the value keeps on changing based on the input sentence. In the GUI there is a "Sample Text" in **Test the Parameters** section, however I just cannot understand what it does because the input text to it does not go to the API via body since I don't get any annotated output.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/12681262/122806732-511c8000-d2e8-11eb-8500-e16aa82fc42a.png)
I expected that the Sample Text will be sent via Body. But apparently that is not the case. Also, when I give the value to the Body Key, then I do see the expected output.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/12681262/122806925-9476ee80-d2e8-11eb-9e60-b1e44fc59e14.png)

But that is not that important. As you can see I have formatted the output in the way Doccano wants as it mentions in the next section. I am thinking that if the output is like what it expects then I don't have to provide any template, right? Moreover, I still don't understand the purpose of the template.....like how exactly am I supposed to use it? Just linking to the whole of Jinja's documentation does not help at all.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/12681262/122807290-00f1ed80-d2e9-11eb-90dc-17fb67494ede.png)

Without any modifications if I run this, I get a massive error as follows -
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/12681262/122807405-2f6fc880-d2e9-11eb-8c28-31a8f5a211d9.png)

Any idea what to do in this section?

issue.title: Auto Labeling how to Write a mapping template to extract labels from API responses

repository.name: doccano
repository.description: Open source annotation tool for machine learning practitioners.

issue.body:
doccano Auto Labeling how to Write a mapping template to extract labels from API responses
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/24869034/113107320-5d87c400-9236-11eb-86b3-28fcd69ac0fd.png)

who can give a demo, how to use jinja write a mapping template, it's hard!

body:
Assuming you are running doccano and your API in seperated containers with exposed ports you would need to specify your **docker hosts** public IP, eg. 192.168.0.10, as 0.0.0.0 refers to each __container's__ public address. Otherwise you could add them to a [docker network](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/31149501/how-to-reach-docker-containers-by-name-instead-of-ip-address) and refer to the container name.

If you didn't find out yet, you can specify the text to be sent to your api by setting it as jinja2 variable in your body:
key: text, value: {{ text }}. Your annotated Sample Text then should be returned by the API.

@uklft I have not been able to understand how to use the jinja template yet. I can however communicate with the REST API fine enough.
Based on what you said, I tried to do the following -
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/12681262/123041545-13684600-d413-11eb-8624-de07b9e741eb.png)
But I get some error. Is this the correct way to use the template? Is there an example in the documentation where I can see how exactly to use this? I have scoured the documentation but couldn't find anything. Any hint would be greatly appreciated.

**EDIT:**  
Since my API output is exactly like how doccano wants, I also tried giving just `{{ input }}` in the Mapping Template. But I get the same error.
When I give just `[]` in the Mapping Template, I get -
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/12681262/123042452-7c03f280-d414-11eb-9cab-076cee9e43c3.png)

**EDIT 2** :
I also tried the following -
```
[
  {% for entity in input %}
    { "label":"{{ entity.label }}", "start_offset": {{ entity.start_offset }}, "end_offset":{{  entity.end_offset }} }
  {% endfor %}
]
```
But I am getting errors as usual.

My API output in the previous section is as follows -
```
[
    {
        "label": "GPE",
        "start_offset": 0,
        "end_offset": 5
    },
    {
        "label": "GPE",
        "start_offset": 24,
        "end_offset": 29
    }
]
```
Which the **Set a template** section confirms -
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/12681262/123045027-10bc1f80-d418-11eb-9713-2149a26a150b.png)

To POST the text you want to annotate the "key: text, value: {{ text }}" thing goes in the "Body" Section from the __Set Parameters__ card. I was referring to [this screenshot](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/12681262/122806925-9476ee80-d2e8-11eb-9e60-b1e44fc59e14.png).

In my opinion just using `{{ input }}` should be fine but it doesn't work for me either. But @EnzoNclt's template works fine.

@armsp I used the same code as you, but there are still some problems in my first step here. Can you show me all your current code and related settings?
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/62092417/123069792-b934a880-d445-11eb-8c1d-ba6fac71e5a4.png)

You can use the parameters like this:
![doccano-post-params](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/35134759/123072566-f3865180-d415-11eb-8041-44da79d81027.png)

Are you using the Spacy api from @armsp? 

**Edit:** For debugging you can get the full Config from http://localhost:8000/v1/projects/1/auto-labeling-configs
Where /projects/__1__/ is your project id (probably 1).

I am so close...thanks to @uklft and @EnzoNclt . I was able to set up auto annotation and all the tests passed. However, when I actually start annotating and click on **Auto Labeling** I don't see anything.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/12681262/123076661-fc3b4f80-d436-11eb-8942-3df4b4de6534.png)
I clicked on the second icon from right and enabled Auto Labeling. 
In my custom API I can see it printing the text so basically it is able to pass all that text to the API. But why I am not seeing the labels?
NOTE: Since my labels are same as SapCy's labels in the last part of setting up the mapping, I didn't do anything.
I am one step away from my goal....any idea why I am not seeing the label's?
Do you have any logs ? Honestly for this one i have no idea, i still have issues on passing my data to the auto-labeling-pipiline, but if you have any logs maybe i could help

@EnzoNclt sorry to bother you once again...can you please tell me how do I get the logs and show it here?

**EDIT**: Also are there any screenshots of how auto annotation looks like in the UI?
